intro: Carex vesicaria subsp. alpigena, commonly known as the alpine sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in mountainous environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that bloom in late summer. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in cold, high-altitude conditions. Botanically, it is part of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants.
